content:
It appeared after a fire in rural Mississippi that Claws the cat had chased his last mouse. However, Firefighter Jared Brister wasn't giving up.
With one of her precious felines already a casualty of the Monday morning fire, Barbara Simmons thought claws was out of his nine lives, as well.  "He was not breathing," she said from 
.  
Barbara obviously hadn't counted on the heroism of Fireman Brister, who put Claws on oxygen and began doing chest compressions for a five-minute span with help from squad-mate Donnie Hodges. I've seen little masks for pets before that are about the size of a solo cup, although I don't know whether that was at our hero's disposal.
Claws, who was briefly hospitalized, returned home Tuesday.
title: Firefighter Revives Cat With CPR
author: whatsrequired
